lines.text: You know, Mrs. Stone, it's very seldom that ones finds a woman with a sense of gambling that you have. Have you played long?
Since I was a child. I used to play with my father and my grandfather.
I can believe that you play a man's game.
That;s one of the nicest comments you could pay me, Mr. Blaine
Not at all. The difference in our two stacks shows that it's more than just flattery.
Let's hope the new cards change your luck.

[Handing back a card]
You better keep this. The ace of spades has never brought me any luck.
I like you.
Thanks.
Don't you think we'd get along much better if we teamed instead of working against each other?
Why not?
Then you want to proceed on a business basis only?
That's right.
You're a very attractive woman, and I'm only human.
I can keep my head.
Can you keep it for both of us?
Mmm-hmmm.
All right. Try it out and see how it works.
I'll chance it It's a gamble... like everything else in life.
You've gambled on everything else... why not love?
Oh, Monte! I never want to leave this house. I want to live here always!
And so you shall!
I never expected you to be my friend.
Perhaps one day you'll look back and see I as the best friend you ever had.
